snippet: Calling the reasoning behind the Feb. 16 injunction “unprecedented and wrong,” an emergency stay was sought in the Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit in New Orleans.
abstract: Obama administration asks Court of Appeals to lift order by Texas district court judge that halted new immigration initiatives, which would provide protection from deportation and work permits to more than four million undocumented immigrants.
lead_paragraph: Calling the reasoning behind the Feb. 16 injunction “unprecedented and wrong,” an emergency stay was sought in the Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit in New Orleans.

headline.main: Administration Asks Court to Lift Order Halting Immigration Programs
headline.print_headline: National Briefing | Washington; Court Is Asked to Lift Texas Immigration Order
